stories.title: We Need to Close the Gender Data Gap by Including Women in Our Algorithms (2020)
A Man Who Sold the Metaverse

stories.text:
There have been dozens of articles coming out over the past several years detailing how Medium is no longer a great home for the aspiring writer/blogger (largest of reasons is due to their paywall). I fully agree with this.

I used to be an occasional blogger, but had some okay traffic (a few posts took off), but definitely not a name for myself where I could take people with me to my own site. What I liked about Medium was their discoverability, shifting to my blog I believe will lose that discoverability.

Are there other platforms or other ways to get organic readership?
stories.title: Ask HN: If not Medium, then what?

stories.text: I recently had a big burst of returns in my Amazon account.  It would be disruptive to me if I were to be “fired” as a customer in ways I have heard about.  Is there an official or unofficial way to guess at the standing of my account?  (Previously I would have been confident that mine was a trouble free, profitable account, but recent returns may have turned its profitability temporarily upside down.)
stories.title: How can I discern my standing as an Amazon customer?
